Detailed Description

Simple surface class built to contain basic features of a triangle mesh.

Member Function Documentation

bool SimpleTrimeshTwo::compare ( const my_float_t *  other_vert_begin,
const uint  num_other_vert,
my_float_t *  closest_pts,
my_float_t *  dists,
const my_float_t *  other_normals_begin = 0,
my_float_t *  best_Ns = 0,
my_float_t *  N_dists = 0,
const my_float_t  max_dist = my_float_max 
) const [virtual]

Find closest point on surface mesh for the given point (pt).

This method is inefficient since it checks each triangle in the mesh to find the closest point for each input vertex. This function exists to help with prototyping and as a fallback, simpler method to check that the more advanced methods still compute the closest point. In particular, we do the most straightforward and naive check of each triangle without first checking vertex distances, etc.

void SimpleTrimeshTwo::compute_close_point ( const my_float_t *  pt,
const my_float_t *  v0,
const my_float_t *  v1,
const my_float_t *  v2,
const my_float_t  prev_best_d,
my_float_t *  best_d,
my_float_t *  closest_pt 
) const

Wrapper to call corresponding_point and update closest_pt and best dist.

This function is not required to be public, but it doesn't matter since it doesn't modify any class variables.

compute features for an alignment

Assumes the array dists is of the same length as the number of vertices

virtual void ASCbase::geometry::SimpleTrimeshTwo::get_current_inverse_3D_transform ( Quaternion *  Q,
my_float_t *  T 
) const [inline, virtual]

The reason we find the transform from the current back to original is SimSite3D moves the query to the db reference frame. The user typically wants to align all dbas hits to the query reference frame. Thus we compute current -> original positions.

bool SimpleTrimeshTwo::load_mutable_faces ( const std::string  faces_fname  )  [private]

Load the faces in a mutable data structure so that we can modify the vertices, faces, and associated pointers during mesh adjustments

my_float_t* ASCbase::geometry::SimpleTrimeshTwo::mutable_vertices_begin (  )  [inline, protected]

Get a non-constant pointer to the beginning of the vertices array.

I am unsure of the "correct" way to tell the g++ compiler which of the vertices begin functions we want -- it always chooses the unconstant one with the same name

const my_float_t* ASCbase::geometry::SimpleTrimeshTwo::normals_begin (  )  const [inline]

Get a pointer to the beginning of the normals array; number of normals is the same as number of vertices

bool SimpleTrimeshTwo::read_face_file ( const std::string  fname,
bool  check_vertex_order,
bool  compute_max_dist_to_centroid 
) [protected]

Read an MSMS face file and build the triangles. If check_vertex_order, make sure the vertices have the correct order or swap them.

bool ASCbase::geometry::SimpleTrimeshTwo::update_closest_pt ( my_float_t *  best_d,
my_float_t *  closest_pt,
const my_float_t  d,
const my_float_t *  cp 
) const [inline, protected]

Simple function to update closest point and distance.

This function is not required to be protected rather than public, but it is rather dangerous in that it uses pointers.
